body.p:
To His Excellency Beriah Magoffin
Governor. of Kentucky.

Your Petitioner Robert Bishop states that at the August Term 1861. of the City Court of Louisville he was fined $50 -- for carrying Concealed a pistol. Your Petitioner is a resident of Lexington Ky -- and was on a visit to Louisville, where the weapon was taken from him & the fine imposed, The trial was had when he was in Lexington & he made no offense, He had a right to carry the weapon, when travelling & had he defended he would not have been fined. Wherefor he asks for a remission of said fine.
The facts stated in the forgoing petition, are true, & under all the circumstances, I concur with the petitioner & asks for a remission of the fine

I think that this fine, imposed without defense, and under the impression well-founded that the case would be dismissed without trial, ought to be remitted. I therefore concur with the Prosecuting Attorney in the case, W. G. Resor, in asking for a remission

T. S. Bell
R. C. Hewitt
Henry Dent
Chief of Police
J. M Delph, Mayor
Geo. W. Johnston

Louisville City Ct.
$50 } Concealed Weapons
Robt. Bishop
